Title: 1. The Godfather
Description: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

Title: 2. The Poseidon Adventure
Description: A group of passengers must embark on a harrowing struggle for survival after a rogue wave capsizes their cruise ship at sea.
filming_locations: ['RMS Queen Mary - 1126 Queens Highway, Long Beach, California, USA']

Title: 3. What's Up, Doc?
Description: The accidental mix-up of four identical plaid overnight bags leads to a series of increasingly wild and wacky situations.
filming_locations: ["Hilton San Francisco Union Square 333 O'Farrell Street San Francisco, California, USA"]

Title: 4. Last Tango in Paris
Description: A young Parisian woman meets a middle-aged American businessman who demands their clandestine relationship be based only on sex.
filming_locations: ["1 Rue de l'Alboni, Passy, Paris 16, Paris, France"]

Title: 5. Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex * But Were Afraid to Ask
Description: Seven stories are trying to answer the question: what is sex? Or maybe they are not trying.
production_companies: ['Brodsky-Gould Productions', 'Jack Rollins & Charles H. Joffe Productions', 'Rollins-Joffe Productions']

Title: 6. Conquest of the Planet of the Apes
Description: In a futuristic world that has embraced ape slavery, Caesar, the son of the late simians Cornelius and Zira, surfaces after almost twenty years of hiding out from the authorities, and prepares for a slave revolt against humanity.

Title: 7. Joe Kidd
Description: An ex-bounty hunter reluctantly helps a wealthy landowner and his henchmen track down a Mexican revolutionary leader.
filming_locations: ['Old Tucson - 201 S. Kinney Road, Tucson, Arizona, USA']

Title: 8. Elvis on Tour
Description: Concert footage and offstage documentary of singer Elvis Presley.

Title: 9. The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
Description: A surreal, virtually plotless series of dreams centered around six middle-class people and their consistently interrupted attempts to have a meal together.

Title: 10. A Cop
Description: After a shaky first heist, a group of thieves plan an even more elaborate and risky second heist.

Title: 11. Cousin Jules
Description: An ode to rural France and the simple joys of life, Dominique Benicheti's glorious masterpiece COUSIN JULES captures the daily routine and rituals of Jules, a blacksmith, living with his wife, Felice, on a small farm in the French countryside.

Title: 12. Solaris
Description: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane.

Title: 13. We Won't Grow Old Together
Description: A husband and wife in a loveless marriage struggle to remain ignorant to their failed relationship.

Title: 14. The Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant
Description: A troubled fashion designer strikes up a romance with a much younger woman.

Title: 15. The Merchant of Four Seasons
Description: Hans Epp is a self-destructive man who lives a dissatisfied life. He tries to find meaning as a fruit vendor, but a heart attack impedes his ability to work, which turns his dissatisfaction into despair.

Title: 16. Cesar & Rosalie
Description: Cesar is in love with Rosalie. But Rosalie isn't making it easy for him, especially when her old flame enters the picture.

Title: 17. Deliverance
Description: Intent on seeing the Cahulawassee River before it's dammed and turned into a lake, outdoor fanatic Lewis Medlock takes his friends on a canoeing trip they'll never forget into the dangerous American back-country.

Title: 18. Pink Flamingos
Description: Notorious Baltimore criminal and underground figure Divine goes up against a sleazy married couple who make a passionate attempt to humiliate her and seize her tabloid-given title as "The Filthiest Person Alive".

Title: 19. Au Pair Girls
Description: Four sexy foreign girls come to England as au pairs, and quickly become quite intimate with their employers, host families, and everyone else they encounter.

Title: 20. Cabaret
Description: A female girlie club entertainer in Weimar Republic era Berlin romances two men while the Nazi Party rises to power around them.
production_companies: ['Allied Artists Pictures', 'ABC Pictures', 'A Feuer and Martin Production']

Title: 21. Fritz the Cat
Description: In the late 1960s, a pretentious, womanizing young cat drops out of college, starts a riot in Harlem, hits the road with an ex-girlfriend and gets mixed up with domestic terrorists.

Title: 22. Beware My Brethren
Description: A religious sect called the Brethren has taken control of widow Birdy, sending her unstable son, Kenny, into a spiraling descent into madness. No woman is safe when Kenny's religious mania overpowers him and leads to murder and chaos.
filming_locations: ['Twickenham Film Studios, St Margarets, Twickenham, Middlesex, England, UK']

Title: 23. Jeremiah Johnson
Description: A mountain man who wishes to live the life of a hermit becomes the unwilling object of a long vendetta by the Crow tribe and proves to be a match for their warriors in single combat on the early frontier.

Title: 24. The Last House on the Left
Description: Two teenage girls heading to a rock concert for one's birthday try to score marijuana in the city, where they are kidnapped and brutalized by a gang of psychopathic convicts.
production_companies: ['Sean S. Cunningham Films', 'The Night Co.', 'Lobster Enterprises']

Title: 25. Aguirre, the Wrath of God
Description: In the 16th century, the ruthless and insane Don Lope de Aguirre leads a Spanish expedition in search of El Dorado.
production_companies: ['Werner Herzog Filmproduktion', 'Hessischer Rundfunk (HR)', 'Estudios Churubusco Azteca S.A.']

Title: 26. The Cowboys
Description: Rancher Wil Andersen is forced to hire inexperienced boys as cowhands in order to get his cattle herd to market on time but the rough drive is full of dangers and a gang of rustlers is trailing them.

Title: 27. The Canterbury Tales
Description: Pasolini's artistic, sometimes violent, always vividly cinematic retelling of some of Chaucer's most erotic tales.

Title: 28. Sounder
Description: The oldest son of a loving and strong family of black sharecroppers comes of age in the Depression-era South after his father is imprisoned for stealing food.

Title: 29. The Way of the Dragon
Description: A country bumpkin martial artist visits his relatives in Rome, Italy, where he must defend them and their restaurant against harassment from brutal gangsters.

Title: 30. Silent Running

Title: 31. The Getaway
Description: A recently-released ex-con and his loyal wife go on the run after a heist goes awry.

Title: 32. Frenzy
Description: A serial murderer is strangling women with a necktie. The London police have a suspect, but he is the wrong man.
filming_locations: ['The Globe pub, Bow Street, Covent Garden, London, England, UK']

Description: In Vinegaroon, Texas, former outlaw Roy Bean appoints himself the judge for the region and dispenses his brand of justice as he sees fit.

Title: 34. What?
Description: During her Italian vacation, a young and beautiful American tourist finds herself as a guest in a coastal villa inhabited by some odd people.
production_companies: ['Compagnia Cinematografica Champion', 'Les Films Concordia', 'Dieter Geissler Filmproduktion']

Title: 35. Fist of Fury
Description: During the Japanese occupation of Shanghai, the star pupil of a recently-deceased martial arts teacher battles a Japanese dojo which seeks the demise of his master's fighting school.

Title: 36. Boxcar Bertha
Description: During the Great Depression, a union leader and a young woman become criminals to exact revenge on the management of a railroad.
writers: ['Ben L. Reitman', 'Joyce Hooper Corrington', 'John William Corrington']

Title: 37. The Big Bird Cage
Description: Blossom (Pam Grier) and Django (Sid Haig) are thieving mercenaries who engineer a prison break from the outside.

Title: 38. Travels with My Aunt
Description: At his mother's funeral, banker Henry meets his Aunt Augusta, an eccentric old woman who takes him on a wild adventure to rescue an old lover.
filming_locations: ['Restaurant Le Train Bleu, Gare de Lyon, Paris 12, Paris, France']

Title: 39. Cries & Whispers
Description: When a woman dying of cancer in early twentieth-century Sweden is visited by her two sisters, long-repressed feelings between the siblings rise to the surface.

Title: 40. The Possession of Joel Delaney
Description: An upper-class Manhattan divorcee comes to believe that her brother is possessed by the spirit of a serial killer who beheaded young women in Spanish Harlem.
filming_locations: ['The Pines, Fire Island, New York, USA']

Title: 41. Prime Cut
Description: A vicious Kansas City slaughterhouse owner and his hick family are having a bloody "beef" with the Chicago crime syndicate over profits from their joint illegal operations. Top enforcer Nick Devlin is sent to straighten things out.

Description: A wealthy author's second wife begins to suspect that her 12-year-old stepson may have murdered his mother, who mysteriously died in a bathtub accident.

Title: 43. The Mechanic
Description: An aging hitman befriends a young man who wants to be a professional killer. Eventually it becomes clear that someone has betrayed them.

Title: 44. Your Vice Is a Locked Room and Only I Have the Key
Description: A string of murders are committed near the estate of a degenerate author, whose abusive relationship with his wife is further complicated by the arrival of his manipulative niece.

Title: 46. Horror Express
Description: While on the Trans-Siberian Express, an anthropologist and his rival must contain the threat posed by the former's cargo: a prehistoric ape which is the host for a parasitic life-form.

Title: 47. Sleuth
Description: A man who loves games and theater invites his wife's lover to meet him, setting up a battle of wits with potentially deadly results.
filming_locations: ['Athelhampton House & Gardens, Athelhampton, Dorchester, Dorset, England, UK']

Title: 48. Slaughterhouse-Five

Title: 49. Avanti!
Description: A successful businessman goes to Italy to arrange for the return of his tycoon father's body--and discovers that Dad died with his long-time mistress.

Title: 50. Sweet Sugar
Description: Prostitute Sugar, set up by a corrupt politician, joins a chain gang led by Dr. John, who performs cruel medical experiments on his employees.

Description: The secretary of a writer and his wife investigates the disappearance of her lover - their previous secretary - and finds herself the target of the couple's erotic desires and a murder plot.

Title: 53. Death Line

Description: When a southern Italian town is rocked by a string of child murders, the police and two urban outcasts search for the culprit amid scapegoating within the superstitious community.

Description: After the first part of the legendary report dealing with the sexual behavior of underage schoolgirls, and the second part dealing with the psychological background, the third part is devoted to striking individual cases.

Description: A serial killer is on the loose. His victims are unfaithful wives and he always leaves compromising photographs at the crime scene.

Description: A musical retelling of the American Revolution's political struggle in the Continental Congress to declare independence.
filming_locations: ['Columbia/Warner Bros. Ranch - 411 North Hollywood Way, Burbank, California, USA']

Title: 61. The Heartbreak Kid
Description: A newlywed man on his honeymoon has second thoughts about his marriage and falls for a different woman.

Description: Bill McKay is a candidate for the U.S. Senate from California. He has no hope of winning, so he is willing to tweak the establishment.

Description: A documentary-style drama about the "Fouke Monster", a Bigfoot-type creature that has been sighted in and around Fouke, Arkansas since the 1950s.

Description: An 18th-century African prince, turned into a vampire by Dracula, finds himself in modern-day Los Angeles.

Description: Daniele, a gambler and poetry professor, takes a teaching job in Rimini. He falls for his 19-year-old student Vanina, who is dating his gambling friend Gerardo. Their affair ends tragically.

Title: 72. Man of La Mancha

Title: 74. The Devil

Description: A group of tourists arrive at a half-finished hotel in Spain where the oddly identical staff and bad weather threaten the building's stability.

Title: 80. The Genesis Children
Description: A group of teen boys go to Rome in this controversial art film.

Title: 81. Love in the Afternoon
Description: Though he has an adoring wife, a bourgeois man is still tempted to pursue other women.

Description: In order to secure a job at a mental institution, a young psychiatrist must interview four patients inside the asylum.

Description: Detectives at a rundown police precinct in Boston scramble to catch a bomber who's targeting local politicians while trying to extort money from the city.

Title: 85. Requiem for a Vampire

Title: 88. What Have You Done to Solange?
Description: A teacher who is having an affair with one of his students is reluctant to present an alibi when his lover witnesses the first in a series of murders connected to their school.

Title: 90. Season of the Witch
Description: A neglected, unhappy suburban housewife gets mixed up in witchcraft with unexpected consequences.

Title: 94. Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion
Description: After being used and betrayed by the detective she had fallen in love with, young Matsu is sent to a female prison full of sadistic guards and disobedient prisoners.

Title: 95. Roma
Description: A fluid, unconnected and sometimes chaotic procession of scenes detailing the various people and events of life in Italy's capital, most of it based on director Federico Fellini's life.

Title: 96. Brother Sun, Sister Moon
Description: Dramatization of events in the life of St. Francis of Assisi from before his conversion experience through his audience with the pope, including his friendship with St. Clare.

Title: 100. Fat City
